events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover medical expenses and some outstanding debts they currently have.
The loan application was reviewed and categorised as a personal loan, focusing on medical and debt relief purposes.
A dedicated loan officer was assigned to handle the applicant's personal loan request and assist throughout the process.
The initial review of the application took place to check eligibility criteria and verify the completeness of the submitted information.
Additional documents including medical bills, income statements, and debt summaries were requested from the applicant for further evaluation.
Applicant promptly provided all requested documents such as medical receipts, pay stubs, and credit reports necessary to process the loan.
Credit report and score analysis was completed to assess the financial reliability and creditworthiness of the applicant.
A thorough risk assessment was conducted considering debt-to-income ratio, credit history, and repayment capability.
A personal loan offer tailored to the applicant's financial needs and repayment ability was formally presented for their consideration.
The applicant responded positively, requesting minor adjustments to the repayment schedule before final approval.
The application was escalated to the senior loan committee to review requested changes and overall loan terms.
The personal loan was approved following committee review, confirming terms that align with the applicant's feedback.
Funds were disbursed to the applicantâ€™s bank account to cover medical expenses and pending debts as requested.
Follow-up call with the applicant ensured satisfaction with the loan process and addressed any further questions on repayment.
The loan application case was formally closed after successful funding and positive post-approval feedback received from the applicant.
